intro: Radiola tetrapetala, commonly known as the four-petaled radiola, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow flowers with four petals, which are arranged in a radial pattern, giving it its common name. Radiola tetrapetala typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its botanical significance lies in its unique floral structure and its potential ecological role in supporting pollinator species.
